intro: Aulandra, commonly known as the bluebell, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained, fertile soil. Aulandra is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in woodland or shady garden settings. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and natural landscapes.
